result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Lee VanNorman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Clerk of Courts Office to pay out restitution to victim immediately.
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Lee VanNorman

defendant.name: VanNorman, Gary Lee
defendant.address: 390 Arlington Ave, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Lee VanNorman in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
12CF73 & 14CF83:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 14CF83.  12CF73 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has paid the Restitution in full today.  Atty Haase agrees and states that this is a joint recommendation.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Atty Hendee states that there has not been a waiver of the Prelim yet.  Atty Haase states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Atty Hendee states that the information will be filed with the court shortly.
Atty Haase understands that the information is the same as the criminal complaint and would like to proceed today.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF83.  12CF73 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court and will file a victim impact statement for 12CF73 case.  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendations.   Atty Hendee asks the COC office to pay out Restitution as the defendant has paid in full today.
Atty Haase makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  14CF83:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution = $726.00 (COC office to pay out payment to victim)
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

12CF73:  Dismissed and read-in
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gary Lee VanNorman in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Atty Hendee states that the defendant has another case 12CF73 that is set for trial; however after speaking with Atty Haase, that matter is resolved.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Prelim.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on January 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
COPY OF LETTER DA SENT DEFENDANT REGARDING COURT DATE
